final_answer.precision_note: Mass from electron moles and provided atomic mass, expressed to three significant figures.

method: Find charge passed during electrolysis: t = 30.0 min = 1800 s, so Q = It = 1.50 × 1800 = 2700 C. Moles of electrons are n(e-) = Q/F = 2700/96500 = 2.80	imes10^-2 mol. From Cu2+ + 2e- -> Cu, moles Cu deposited are half the electron moles: n(Cu)=n(e-)/2=1.40	imes10^-2 mol. Using Cu molar mass from data, 63.55 g mol^-1, m(Cu)=1.40	imes10^-2 × 63.55 = 0.889 g.
checks: Each Cu atom needs 2 electrons, so moles Cu are exactly half moles of electrons.
Faraday constant 96,500 C mol^-1 controls the electron-to-mole conversion.
Mass 0.889 g corresponds to 0.0139 mol Cu, matching expected deposit size.
